reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Pre-Eliminatino Scale-Up of Malaria COntrol Intervention in Namibia

description.narrative: Malaria is a major health problem in Namibia, the leading cause of illness and death among children under age five and the third leading cause of death in adults. The program supported by this grant aims to reduce the burden of malaria to such an extent that it will neither be the major contributor to illness and death, nor of significant socio-economic impediment by the year 2030. The program targets nine regions with 22 health districts endemic to high malaria prevalence, pregnant women and children under age five. Activities broadly focus on vector control, personal protection, case management, surveillance and epidemic preparedness, detection and response and operational research.

Coverage / Output indicator for NMB-202-G03-M-00
% of health facilities with no RDT stock outs lasting one week or more in the last three months
CM-other 3 : % of health facilities with no RDT stock outs lasting one week or more in the last three months
Percentage of health facilities with no stock outs of ACTs lasting one week or more in the last three months
CM-other 4 : % of health facilities with no stock outs of ACTs lasting one week or more in the last three months
CM-other 2 : Percentage of health facilities reporting complete weekly surveillance data on time
Proportion of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test at public sector health facilities
% of all confirmed cases that are notified via Rapid Case Investigation system and classified (completed case investigation form)

Percentage of fever cases tested by RDT or Microscopy in zones 1 and 2m /indicator formulation modified from July 2016 to Percentage of fever /suspected cases tested by RDT or Microscopy at public sector health faciliteis
Proportion of confirmed malaria cases that received first-line antimalarial treatment at public sector health facilities
Percentage of confirmed malaria cases treated according to national guidelines
Impact indicator for NMB-202-G03-M-00
RCC Phase 1: Number of confirmed malaria in-patient cases
Confirmed malaria cases (microscopy or RDT): rate per 1000 persons per year
RCC Phase 2: Incidence of malaria (confirmed cases per 1,000)
RCC Phase 2: Number of confirmed malaria deaths
Malaria I-Other 1: Number of confirmed malaria deaths
RCC Phase 1: Malaria Test Positivity Rate
RCC Phase 2: Percentage of districts with below 1 confirmed malaria case per 1000 population (incidence) due to local transmission
Malaria I- Other: Percentage of districts with below 1 confirmed malaria case per 1000 population (incidence) due to local transmission
RCC Phase 1: Number of in-patients malaria deaths
Outcome indicator for NMB-202-G03-M-00
RCC Phase 1: Number of laboratory-confirmed severe and uncomplicated malaria cases treated
Proportion of population using an insecticide-treated net among those with access to an insecticide-treated net
RCC Phase 1 and 2: Percentage of people in targeted communities who slept under an LLIN the previous night
% of population in endemic areas protected by indoor residual spraying
RCC Phase 2: Percentage of households with at least one LLIN per two people
Proportion of households with at least one insecticide-treated net for every two people
RCC Phase 1: % of households with at least one long lasting insecticide-treated net (LLIN)
RCC Phase 2: Percentage of structures in targeted areas covered by IRS
Malaria O-Other 1: Percentage of structures in targeted areas covered by IRS
